H0.text: The title of the play Arms and the Man by George Bernard Shaw comes from the opening words of the Aeneid by which Roman poet. Ovid

H1.text: The title of the play Arms and the Man by George Bernard Shaw comes from the opening words of the Aeneid by which Roman poet. Catullus

H2.text: The title of the play Arms and the Man by George Bernard Shaw comes from the opening words of the Aeneid by which Roman poet. Horace

H3.text: The title of the play Arms and the Man by George Bernard Shaw comes from the opening words of the Aeneid by which Roman poet. Virgil

A4.text: The Aeneid is widely considered Virgil's finest work, and one of the most important poems in the history of literature

A5.text: The work, modelled after Homer's Iliad and Odyssey, chronicles the journey of a warrior and refugee of the Trojan War, named Aeneas
